page.title: 19GREETWELL QUARRY
page.content: This quarry is situated in the South West corner of our block. From Cherry Willingham and Reepham it is hardly visible but from the edge of Lincoln (along Outer Circle Road) it is clearly a large hole. The site is roughly square with a side of about a quarter of a kilometre in length. It is not an old site in itself but there have been workings in the area for hundreds of years taking out ironstone and limestone. The workings now take out limestone which we think is for the foundations of roads. Owned by the Church Commisioners the quarry is commercially let although the production rates and other details were not available. The original quarry supplied stone for the nearby Lincoln cathedral and Greetwell church. J.WHITTINGHAM
